Docs.summary: Returns an integer corresponding to the bits of the given double precision value.

Docs.summary: Maximum base-2 exponent that a finite value of the double type may have.

remarks.para: Maximum base-2 exponent that a finite value of the double type may have. Equal to Math.getExponent(Double.MAX_VALUE).

Docs.summary: Constant for the maximum double value, (2 - 2-52) * 21023.

remarks.para: Constant for the maximum double value, (2 - 2-52) * 21023.

Docs.summary: Minimum base-2 exponent that a normal value of the double type may have.

remarks.para: Minimum base-2 exponent that a normal value of the double type may have. Equal to Math.getExponent(Double.MIN_NORMAL).

Docs.summary: Constant for the smallest positive normal value of the double type.

remarks.para: Constant for the smallest positive normal value of the double type.

Docs.summary: Constant for the minimum double value, 2-1074.

remarks.para: Constant for the minimum double value, 2-1074.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
